'''Swellow''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''オオスバメ''' ''Ohsubame'') is a dual-type {{2t|Normal|Flying}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation III]].

It [[Evolution|evolve]]s from {{p|Taillow}} starting at [[level]] 22.

==Biology==
Swellow is a large, dark blue bird Pokémon with a red breast and face. A crest of feathers sweeps back from the top of its head. A blue stripe separates the red markings on its head and chest, and it has a white underside. It has small, narrow eyes, a pointed, yellow beak, and red feet with black talons. Each foot has three forward-facing toes and one pointed backward. Two long, pointed feathers with red tips form its tail, and are an indication of good health when standing up straight. Swellow's wings taper to a sharp point. An impressive dive-bomber, it will never miss its target. Additionally, it takes great pride in its glossy plumage, and often cleans the wings of other Swellow. It searches for {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Grassland Pokémon|warm meadows}} while in the air. Swellow preys on {{p|Wurmple}}.

==In the anime==
===In the main series===
[[File:Ash Swellow.png|220px|thumb|left|Swellow in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
[[File:Winona Swellow.png|thumb|left|220px|Shiny Swellow in the anime]]
====Major appearances====
=====[[Ash's Swellow]]=====
Ash's {{p|Taillow}} evolved into Swellow in ''[[AG080|That's Just Swellow]]'' during the final round of the {{to|Crossgate}} [[PokéRinger]].

=====Other=====
Swellow debuted in ''[[AG046|Candid Camerupt]]''. Vito of the [[Winstrate family]] used it to secretly protect his family.

[[Winona]]'s {{shiny}} Swellow debuted in ''[[AG085|Sky High Gym Battle!]]''. Winona used it during her battle against {{Ash}} in the [[Fortree Gym]]. Swellow was used to battle {{AP|Grovyle}}, which it was able to defeat, but it was later defeated by Ash's own {{AP|Swellow}}.

====Minor appearances====
A Swellow appeared in ''[[DP118|Pursuing a Lofty Goal!]]'' as one of the participants of [[Squallville]] [[PokéRinger]] where it was used against a {{p|Wingull}}.

Multiple Swellow made a brief cameo in ''[[M11|Giratina and the Sky Warrior]]''.

Multiple Swellow appeared in ''[[BW130|Butterfree and Me!]]''.

A Swellow was among the {{type|Flying}} Pokémon who raced {{OBP|Mewtwo|Best Wishes series}} in ''[[M16|Genesect and the Legend Awakened]]''.

A Swellow appeared in the Hoopa's Surprise Ring Adventures short ''{{DL|Hoopa's Surprise Ring Adventures|Flying in the Air}}''.

A {{pkmn|Trainer}}'s Swellow appeared in ''[[XY077|A Relay in the Sky!]]'' participating in the [[Pokémon Sky Relay]].

===In Pokémon Generations===
A Swellow appeared during a flashback in ''[[PG18|The Redemption]]'' as one of the many Pokémon fighting in the great war of [[Kalos]], 3,000 years previously.

==In the manga==
[[File:Blaise Swellow Adventures.png|thumb|200px|Swellow in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
The [[Three Fires]] of [[Team Magma]] each own a Swellow that they use for aerial transport.
* [[Tabitha]]'s Swellow appeared in ''[[PS199|Adding It Up with Plusle & Minun II]]''.
* [[Magma Admin Courtney|Courtney]]'s Swellow appeared in ''[[PS199|Adding It Up with Plusle & Minun II]]''.
* [[Blaise]]'s Swellow first appeared in ''[[PS200|Tripped Up by Torkoal]]''.

[[Maxie]] has a Swellow who first appeared in ''[[PS230|Walrein and Camerupt]]''.

The Battle Factory rented a Swellow which was stolen by [[Guile Hideout]] in ''[[PS334|The Final Battle VII]]''.

==In the TCG==
{{main|Swellow (TCG)}}

==Game data==
===NPC appearances===
* [[Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Time and Explorers of Darkness]]: Swellow is one of the members of [[Team Tasty]], alongside {{p|Wurmple}}. Throughout the game, Wurmple is scared that Swellow will eat him. Only at the end of the game does Swellow realize this. He later reappears as a recruitable character in Super Mystery Dungeon, still proudly declaring himself as Wurmple's team mate.

==Trivia==

===Origin===
Swellow is based directly on swallows, specifically a {{wp|barn swallow}} or {{wp|welcome swallow}}. However, it shares characteristics with other types of birds as well. In terms of behavior, its predatory habits and incredible speed suggest inspiration from {{wp|falcon}}s, or perhaps the {{wp|swallow-tailed kite}}. Its coloration, appearance, and crested head are similar to {{wp|treeswift}}s, though its head also resembles that of a {{wp|secretary bird}}. Swellow's {{Shiny}} colors of green, red and white, combined with its two long tail feathers, also resemble the {{wp|Resplendent Quetzal}}.

====Name origin====
Swellow is a combination of ''swell'' (to grow larger) and ''{{wp|Hirundinidae|swallow}}''.

Ohsubame is a corruption of 大燕 ''ōtsubame'' (large swallow). ''Ohsubame'' may also mean ''big {{p|Taillow|Subame}}''.
